intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium imberbe, commonly known as the naked hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny conditions. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium imberbe is often considered a weed but has ecological value in supporting pollinators.
